brainly_data.question: A right cylindrical tank with a total volume of 5,000 cubic units has an interior diameter of 20 units. the volume gauge indicates that the tank is 60% full. to the nearest 5 units, what is the interior height of the fluid in the tank?
brainly_data.subject: Mathematics

all_answers.question: A right cylindrical tank with a total volume of 5,000 cubic units has an interior diameter of 20 units. the volume gauge indicates that the tank is 60% full. to the nearest 5 units, what is the interior height of the fluid in the tank?
all_answers.subject: Mathematics
all_answers.text:
Total volume of the tank is 5000 cubic units
Volume of liquid=60%*5000=3000 cubic units
the height of the fluid will be found as follows
V=πr²h
where:
r=20/2=10 units
hence:plugging in the values and solving for h we get:
3000=π×(10²)×h
thus
h=3000/(100π)
h=9.5292966
h=9.5293 units
